org.apache.juneau.remoteable

Annotation Type Remoteable

  • Deprecated. 
    Use org.apache.juneau.rest.client.remote

    @Deprecated
 @Documented
 @Target(value={TYPE,METHOD})
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Inherited
public @interface Remoteable

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      String expose
      Deprecated. 
      Identifies which methods on the interface should be exposed through the proxy.
      String methodPaths
      Deprecated. 
      Defines the methodology to use for the path names of the methods when not explicitly defined via @RemoteMethod.path().
      String path
      Deprecated. 
      The absolute or relative path of the REST service.

    • Element Detail

      • path

        public abstract String path
        Deprecated. 
        The absolute or relative path of the REST service.

        When a relative path is specified, it's relative to the root-url defined on the RestClient used to instantiate the interface.

        When no path is specified, the path is assumed to be the class name (e.g. "http://localhost/root-url/org.foo.MyInterface")

        Default:
        ""

      • expose

        public abstract String expose
        Deprecated. 
        Identifies which methods on the interface should be exposed through the proxy.

        The options are:

        • "DECLARED" (default) - Only methods declared on the immediate interface/class are exposed. Methods on parent interfaces/classes are ignored.
        • "ANNOTATED" - Only methods annotated with RemoteMethod are exposed.
        • "ALL" - All methods defined on the interface or class are exposed.
        Default:
        "DECLARED"

      • methodPaths

        public abstract String methodPaths
        Deprecated. 
        Defines the methodology to use for the path names of the methods when not explicitly defined via @RemoteMethod.path().

        The options are:

        • "NAME" (default) - Use the method name (e.g. "myMethod").
        • "SIGNATURE" - Use the method signature (e.g. "myMethod(int,boolean,java.lang.String,int[][][])").

        Note that if you use "NAME", method names must be unique in the interface.

        Default:
        "NAME"
